> How do you guys deal with cultural differences?
> 

While on the forum, the forum culture supersedes all others. This forum has unique practices and ways of speaking that aren't seen in other forums or in real life. For example, "delta-v" is a term often used here, but not very often in anyone's day to day life no matter the culture they come from or the language they speak. This is why culture clashes don't happen often here, there's only really one culture.

So to answer your question, we don't because there aren't.

> What day and what time do you see the most activity?
> 

What Red said.  We don't really have a sharp spike of *<u>increased</u>* activity, mainly because users are smeared across a fair number of time zones.

However, we do kinda have a trough of *<u>low</u>* activity, corresponding to the time period when the Americas have mostly gone to bed, but Europe mostly hasn't woken up yet.  The large majority of our users are either in Europe or the Americas.  (Certainly we have users practically everywhere, but Europe and the Americas seem to have the lion's share.)

I have the impression that activity tends to tick upwards a bit on weekends, since that's when folks tend to have more free time, aren't at work, etc.  (Certainly that's when I see an uptick in the download rate of my mods, which I can see a handy graph for-- there's always an uptick on Saturday / Sunday after I release an update.)

It's worth noting that you can answer this question pretty much as well as the mods can, just by looking at forums and posts and stuff.  ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")
